titles.title: Authorizing the use of the rotunda of the Capitol to honor the last surviving United States veteran of the First World War upon his death.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR H1377)
Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

bill.summary: 2/28/2011--Introduced. Declares that, in recognition of the historic contributions of the U.S. veterans who served in World War I, the last surviving U.S. veteran of such War should be permitted to lie in honor in the rotunda of the Capitol upon his death, so that U.S. citizens may pay their last respects to these great Americans.
